name: Authorizer
description: Basic Authorizer implementation, based on OpenZeppelin's Access Control. Users are allowed to perform actions if they have the role with the same identifier. In this sense, roles are not being truly used as such, since they each map to a single action identifier. This temporary implementation is expected to be replaced soon after launch by a more sophisticated one, able to manage permissions across multiple contracts and to natively handle timelocks.

functionDecorators.name: canPerform
functionDecorators.description: Returns true if `account` can perform the action described by `actionId` in the contract `where`.

functionDecorators.name: getRoleAdmin
functionDecorators.description: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

functionDecorators.name: getRoleGlobalMember
functionDecorators.description: Returns one of the accounts that have `role` across contracts. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleGlobalMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleGlobalMember} and {getRoleGlobalMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

functionDecorators.name: getRoleGlobalMemberCount
functionDecorators.description: Returns the number of accounts that have `role` as global permission. Can be used together with {getRoleGlobalMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

functionDecorators.name: getRoleMemberByContract
functionDecorators.description: Returns one of the accounts that have `role` in contract `where`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCountByContract}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMemberByContract} and {getRoleMemberCountByContract}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

functionDecorators.name: getRoleMemberCountByContract
functionDecorators.description: Returns the number of accounts that have `role` as global permission. Can be used together with {getRoleGlobalMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

functionDecorators.name: grantRole
functionDecorators.description: Grants `role` to `account` in specific contracts. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. - list of ``where``'s can't be empty.

functionDecorators.name: grantRoleGlobally
functionDecorators.description: Grants `role` to `account` in across all contracts. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

functionDecorators.name: grantRoles
functionDecorators.description: Grants multiple roles to a single account for a set of contracts.

functionDecorators.name: grantRolesGlobally
functionDecorators.description: Grants multiple roles to a single account for all contracts.

functionDecorators.name: grantRolesGloballyToMany
functionDecorators.description: Grants roles to a list of accounts for all contracts.

functionDecorators.name: grantRolesToMany
functionDecorators.description: Grants roles to a list of accounts for a set of contracts.

functionDecorators.name: hasRole
functionDecorators.description: Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role` either globally or in specific `where`.

functionDecorators.name: renounceRole
functionDecorators.description: Revokes `role` from the calling account, for specific contracts. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. - list of ``where``'s can't be empty.

functionDecorators.name: renounceRoleGlobally
functionDecorators.description: Revokes `role` from the calling account, for all contracts. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRole
functionDecorators.description: Revokes `role` from `account` accross all. If `account` had already been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. - list of ``where``'s can't be empty.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRoleGlobally
functionDecorators.description: Revokes `role` from `account` across all contracts. If `account` had already been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRoles
functionDecorators.description: Revokes multiple roles from a single account for a set of contracts.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRolesFromMany
functionDecorators.description: Revokes roles from a list of accounts across a set of contracts.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRolesGlobally
functionDecorators.description: Revokes multiple roles from a single account for all contracts.

functionDecorators.name: revokeRolesGloballyFromMany
functionDecorators.description: Revokes roles from a list of accounts.
